definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
with keen interest (idiom)/with great pleasure/with gusto/eagerly

sentences.english: He turned to an editorial and began reading it with interest.
sentences.chinese: 他翻到裏面的一篇論文，津津有味地讀起來。

sentences.english: Chinese boys watch a cartoon at a toy fair in Beijing on July 29 2010.
sentences.chinese: 北京的玩具展會場中，兩小男孩津津有味地在看卡通。

sentences.english: Ray was so hungrythathe enjoyed every morsel of the stale bread.
sentences.chinese: 瑞因太飢餓了，所以津津有味地喫每一口乾硬的麪包。

sentences.english: The bird enjoyed a dinner of flatfish…
sentences.chinese: 小鳥先津津有味地吞進一條比目魚。

sentences.english: Such feeling is just meaningful, yet endless in aftertaste.
sentences.chinese: 這種感覺還是比較有味，且回味無窮。

sentences.english: Live each day in the present, and take it beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 過好現在的每一天，而且過得有滋有味。

sentences.english: Want to spice things up in the bedroom?
sentences.chinese: 想讓牀第生活更加有滋有味嗎？

sentences.english: We had a beautiful lunch and luxury lunch break of more than one hour.
sentences.chinese: 大家喫喝得珍珍有味，豪華地休整了一個多鐘頭。

sentences.english: She was overjoyed and rewarded the redcoat with a goblet of wine, which he drank with relish.
sentences.chinese: 那女士高興極了，奉酒一杯，那英兵喝得津津有味。

sentences.english: There was no water and the bread was dry, but he enjoyed it.
sentences.chinese: 沒有水，麪包又很乾，但是他喫得有滋有味。
克勞斯津津有味地體驗着世人的關注。

sentences.english: He managed to live reasonably well in London only because he has some investments.
sentences.chinese: 他能在倫敦生活地有滋有味全靠他在這裏有部分投資。

sentences.english: He takes great delight in eating lobster.
sentences.chinese: 他津津有味地喫着大龍蝦。

sentences.english: The teacher regaled the children with some fairy tales.
sentences.chinese: 老師講了些神話故事，孩子們聽得津津有味。

sentences.english: Yet Liu remembers her soldiering days with relish.
sentences.chinese: 然而，劉天佑回憶起那些日子仍然津津有味。

sentences.english: The villagers threw themselves into the ceremonies with gusto.
sentences.chinese: 村民們津津有味地圍觀儀式。

definition: lit. just the right flavor/just right/just the thing/excellent
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
to make one's mouth water/appetizing/greedy person/glutton
